results.title: Up against it
results.creator_credit: Cath Cantlon and Henley Beach Mural Collective
results.brief_description: A documentary on the painting of a large mural on a sea wall at Adelaide’s Henley Beach. Shows the design considerations, research, the process of involving the local council and school students, and the preparation and painting of the wall.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cath Cantlon and Henley Beach Mural Collective
results.description: A documentary on the painting of a large mural on a sea wall at Adelaide’s Henley Beach. Shows the design considerations, research, the process of involving the local council and school students, and the preparation and painting of the wall.
description_for_label: A documentary on the painting of a large mural on a sea wall at Adelaide’s Henley Beach. Shows the design considerations, research, the process of involving the local council and school students, and the preparation and painting of the wall.

results.title: Social security benefits: right or privilege?
results.creator_credit: Roger Ley, David Gardner and Centre for Study of Higher Education, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of a field officer with the Commonwealth Department of Social Security. Shows how the evidence found by the field officer can determine the continuation or cessation of a benefit. See also “Branda’s appeal”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Ley, David Gardner and Centre for Study of Higher Education, University of Melbourne
results.description: Outlines the work of a field officer with the Commonwealth Department of Social Security. Shows how the evidence found by the field officer can determine the continuation or cessation of a benefit. See also “Branda’s appeal”.

results.title: Open doors ... opportunities in trade training for women
results.brief_description: Interviews with women apprentices show the opportunities in various trades; they are training to be nursery attendants, motor mechanics, plumbers, refrigeration mechanics, and optical glass makers. They speak about career prospects, work satisfaction and attitudes towards female apprentices. No other credits available.
results.title_for_label: Open doors … opportunities in trade training for women
results.description: Interviews with women apprentices show the opportunities in various trades; they are training to be nursery attendants, motor mechanics, plumbers, refrigeration mechanics, and optical glass makers. results.title: Through a looking glass; Drama is -
results.creator_credit: Vincent O'Donnell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Two drama education programs: “Through a looking glass” shows the major concepts underlaying drama in education and how the teacher can participate with the student in the dramatic process. “Drama is -” explores the ways in which drama can be used as a method to teach many subject areas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent O’Donnell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.description: Two drama education programs: “Through a looking glass” shows the major concepts underlaying drama in education and how the teacher can participate with the student in the dramatic process. “Drama is -” explores the ways in which drama can be used as a method to teach many subject areas.

results.title: Getting into jeans
results.creator_credit: Paul Wingate, Chris Strange, Ross D Wylie and AVCOM Productions
results.brief_description: Graeme (Shirley) Strachan presents an overview of the production of a pair of jeans from the beginning of the design process through to the sale to the customer. Shows the function of computers in laying out pattern pieces to the material available, the machinist at work, and the activity of wholesalers and retailers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Wingate, Chris Strange, Ross D Wylie and AVCOM Productions
results.description: Graeme (Shirley) Strachan presents an overview of the production of a pair of jeans from the beginning of the design process through to the sale to the customer. results.title: Going outside: to play, to imagine, to learn
results.creator_credit: Rick Cavaggion and Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Outlines ways in which teachers can develop children’s awareness of the natural environment. In a bush setting, five to eleven-year-olds role play the Dam Conflict Game, learning how to become involved in an issue and how to communicate their feelings.
results.title_for_label: Going outside: to play, to imagine, to learn

results.title: You've got to start somewhere
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Maureen McCarthy and Trout Films
results.brief_description: Focuses on a multicultural project at Ferntree Gully Primary School to show what teachers at schools with low migrant populations can do to put the philosophy of education in a multicultural society into practice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Warner, Maureen McCarthy and Trout Films

results.title: Suburban streetscape: living Hawthorn 1906 & 1979
results.creator_credit: Michael Rogers, Weston Bate and Deakin University
results.brief_description: Compares 1906 footage of the main streets of the Melbourne suburb of Hawthorn with footage of the same streets in 1979. Contains b&w footage.

results.title: A Shame Like Alice. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, Lee Gordon Productions and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.

In March 1983 Focus spent one week in the Northern Territory looking at the living conditions of First Nations people in the most famous small town in Australia, Alice Springs. Includes interviews with Neville Bonner and Al Grassby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Lee, Lee Gordon Productions and SBS-TV
